refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Schedules asynchronous I/O operations. GIOScheduler integrates into the main event loop (GMainLoop) and may use threads if they are available.

para.para: I/O priority Each I/O operation has a priority, and the scheduler uses the priorities to determine the order in which operations are executed. They are not used to determine system-wide I/O scheduling. Priorities are integers, with lower numbers indicating higher priority. It is recommended to choose priorities between G_PRIORITY_LOW and G_PRIORITY_HIGH, with G_PRIORITY_DEFAULT as a default.

refsect2.title: GIOSchedulerJob
refsect2.para: Opaque class for definining and scheduling IO jobs.

refsect2.title: GIOSchedulerJobFunc ()
refsect2.para: Note that depending on whether threads are available, the GIOScheduler may run jobs in separate threads or in an idle in the mainloop.
Long-running jobs should periodically check the cancellable to see if they have been cancelled.

listitem.simpara: optional GCancellable object, NULL to ignore.
the data to pass to callback function
TRUE if this function should be called again to complete the job, FALSE if the job is complete (or cancelled)

refsect2.title: g_io_scheduler_push_job ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_io_scheduler_push_job (GIOSchedulerJobFunc job_func, gpointer user_data, GDestroyNotify notify, gint io_priority, GCancellable *cancellable);
refsect2.para: Schedules the I/O job to run.
notify will be called on user_data after job_func has returned, regardless whether the job was cancelled or has run to completion.
If cancellable is not NULL, it can be used to cancel the I/O job by calling g_cancellable_cancel() or by calling g_io_scheduler_cancel_all_jobs().

listitem.simpara: a GDestroyNotify for user_data, or NULL
the I/O priority of the request.
optional GCancellable object, NULL to ignore.

refsect2.title: g_io_scheduler_cancel_all_jobs ()
refsect2.para: A job is cancellable if a GCancellable was passed into g_io_scheduler_push_job().

refsect2.title: g_io_scheduler_job_send_to_mainloop ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean g_io_scheduler_job_send_to_mainloop (GIOSchedulerJob *job, GSourceFunc func, gpointer user_data, GDestroyNotify notify);
refsect2.para: Used from an I/O job to send a callback to be run in the main loop (main thread), waiting for the result (and thus blocking the I/O job).

listitem.simpara: a GSourceFunc callback that will be called in the main thread
a GDestroyNotify for user_data, or NULL

refsect2.title: g_io_scheduler_job_send_to_mainloop_async ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_io_scheduler_job_send_to_mainloop_async (GIOSchedulerJob *job, GSourceFunc func, gpointer user_data, GDestroyNotify notify);
refsect2.para: Used from an I/O job to send a callback to be run asynchronously in the main loop (main thread). The callback will be run when the main loop is available, but at that time the I/O job might have finished. The return value from the callback is ignored.

Note that if you are passing the user_data from g_io_scheduler_push_job() on to this function you have to ensure that it is not freed before func is called, either by passing NULL as notify to g_io_scheduler_push_job() or by using refcounting for user_data.

listitem.simpara: a GSourceFunc callback that will be called in the main thread
a GDestroyNotify for user_data, or NULL
